==Dialogue==
===Dialogue Set #1===
{{Dialogue Start}}
:'''Arakunti:''' Sound of cooking~ Sound of making puzzles~ And sounds of chasing~ Noisy and messy, but this is how Festival Utsava sounds~
:{{DIcon}} About Festival Utsava...
::'''Arakunti:''' We meet again, Nara {{Traveler}}.
::'''Arakunti:''' Nara {{Traveler}} is singing at Festival Utsava, right? That must sound like sunshine and moonlight mixed together, sky and water pool overlapping, and dewdrops and raindrops shaking hands.
::'''Arakunti:''' Sing with Nara {{Traveler}}, Paimon. No slacking off.
:{{DIcon}} Goodbye.
::'''Arakunti:''' Bye, Nara {{Traveler}}.
{{Dialogue End}}

===Dialogue Set #2===
{{Dialogue Start}}
:'''Arakunti:''' Nara {{Traveler}}'s songs sound golden, just like the warm sun. Arakunti keeps that in mind.
:{{DIcon}} About singing...
::'''Arakunti:''' Arakunti heard the songs of Nara {{Traveler}}. Brave, and full of hope.
::'''Arakunti:''' Just like Nara Varuna, in the stories.
::'''Arakunti:''' But Nara Varuna never returns to Vanarana. Please come visit, Nara {{Traveler}}.
:{{DIcon}} Goodbye.
::'''Arakunti:''' Yes... Promise to come back, please, Nara {{Traveler}}.
{{Dialogue End}}

==Trivia==
===Etymology===
* "Arakunti" is derived from {{W|Kunti}}; as with other Aranaras involved in ''[[Varuna Gatha]]'', they are named after characters from the Sanskrit epic {{W|Mahabharata}}.
